headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; Arrival of the Quaker City--Arrival of the Spanish Fleet at Havana.
THE CALAMITY ON THE ST, LAWRENCE.; A LIST OF THE PASSENGERS. Particulars of the Occurrence---Heart-rending Scenes. The Burning of the Steamer Montreal.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Saturday morning, early, our citizens were alarmed with the awful intelligence of the destruction of the Montreal, with a living freight of several hundreds of passengers. We immediately conveyed the sorrowful tidings to the public in an Extra, and, as the day proceeded, furnished such particulars as we could collect from time to time.

docs.lead_paragraph: WHAT WILL HE DO WITH IT ?--The title of BULWER LYTTON'S new novel, which stares our citizens in the face from all the brick-piles, board fences, and old rookeries, in the City, seems like a pointed interrogation aimed at our City Inspector, who is making an effort to rec move the filth from our streets, but has nosuitable place to deposit it in.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE ILLINOIS.; THE NICARAGUA TRANSIT IMBROGLIO. Arrival of Fillibusters from San Juan del Norte and Punta Arenas. Message from President Ospina Encouraging a Set tlement of the Difficulty with the United States. Protectorate of England and France over the Chincha Islands. LATER FROM THE WEST INDIES. TWO WEEKS LATER FROM CALIFORNIA AND OREGON. Great Losses at the United States Branch Mint Further Particulars of the Slaughter in Sonora. Withdrawal of the U. S. Minister from Bogota. DISSENSIONS AMONG THE SAINTS IN UTAH.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States mail steamer Illinois, C. S. BOGGS, U. S. N., commanding, left Aspinwall June 19, at 9:20 P. M., and arrived at Quarantine at 8 1/2 o'clock Saturday evening. She brings the California mails of the 5th inst., $1,852,867 in treasure on freight, and 736 passengers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Miss ANNIE M. ANDREWS, the young lady whose voluntary services to the sick during the prevalence of the Norfolk pestilence have made her name famous is preparing for the press a volume descriptive of the "Heroes of the Pestilence," which will be published by the HAEPEES early in the Fall.
docs.abstract: Writes the Heroes of the Pestilence

headline.main: LAW INTELLIGENCE.; SUPERIOR COURT--GENERAL TERM.. DECISIONS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ordered that the Special Term of this Court be continued until Saturday, the 4th day of July. Robt, L. Tilton vs. The Hamilton Fire Insurance Company,--Judgment for plaintiff on the verdict Issac Merritt vs. Jared V. Brewster,--New trial ordered--costs to abide event. Herman W. Linneman vs. John H. Sehoufeld at New trial ordered: action sent back to the same referee.

headline.main: THE MORMONS.; THEIR "BRANCH" IN NEW-YORK. Sabbath Services-Communion Ceremony-Speeches by Salt Lake missionaries-A Hand- Cart song to "Oh Susuannah," &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Mormons do not all live at Salt Lake, as some persons seem to suppose, although one of the chief aims of Mormon missionary enterprise seems to be to "gather the Saints together in Zion,-in the valleys of the mountains, "as they term their settlements in Utah.
